Name: Middara: Lupercalia Pack Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Lupercalia Pack
An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Lupercalia Pack. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Espers that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurers that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes 3x Lupercalia miniatures on 25mm bases, 3x Adventurer card, 3x Loyal Esper Cards, 3x Opposing Esper Cards, 7x Initiative Cards, 4x Item Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Middara: Faunus, God of the Nymphs Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Faunus
An exceptionally detailed resin model of Faunus. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes a Faunus miniature on a 50mm base, 1x Adventurer card, 2x Loyal Esper Cards, 2x Opposing Esper Cards, 4x Item Cards, 4x Initiative Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Aloha Earth
Description:
In Aloha Earth, players take the roles of alien "Experts of Human Things" to debate the details of a now-extinct (due to...something?) human civilization. Every earth-year, the Human Summit meets to debate important topics such as whether a "Triple Vegan" is a "Transcended Human Being" or a "Sports Pass performed only with a Cabbage".

The whimsical improvisational style puts all players on an even playing field. Because the alien experts don't know what humans were actually like, they can infer results that might be based on complete nonsense. Because YOU are the expert, however, no one can say "You're wrong!"

The scoring in the game inspires collaborative storytelling. After a debate, all players vote on someone who told the most convincing backstory for the object or reference. That player scores two points, but then must award a bonus point to another player who best helped them come to that conclusion!

Name: Brew: Companion Creature mini-expansion
Description:
Companion Creatures provides a powerful new action you can use once per round at any time on your turn. When you use your Companion, turn it sideways to show it is Exhausted. At the end of each round, refresh your Companion to show you can use it again during the next round.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scarlet Envelope V: Wild Mansion of Mr.Ferri
Description:
This is the fifth game in the series of "Scarlet Envelope" games.

This tabletop escape room game tells a mysterious story of Mr.Ferri, the extravagant animal lover and the owner of the creepiest mansion in town, who has suddenly passed away. The word on the street is that he was killed…by his own lion! But…was he really? And why is his wife hiring you to get him back home, while his son is talking to Ferri’s spirit through the ouija board? Looks like we've got another mystery on our hands!

GAME CONTENTS:
- Mysterious paper-based Ouija spirit board
- Photo from the Ferri mansion dining room
- Three cryptic polaroid photos
- Letter from Mr.Ferri's wife
- Greeting card with a condolence message
- Private investigator's report
- Voicemail message, audio files
- Emailing the character to get extra digital files
- Web safe box to unlock online
- Instructions and Online Hints in case you're stuck

This game features some very unusual special effects! The story is packed with puzzles. You need a device with an Internet connection + we recommend playing at home (you'll understand why). Roughly 2 hours of gameplay. Two levels of difficulty available.

-description from publisher

Name: Relic Quest
Description:
When war broke out between the Five Kingdoms it devastated Sanctum as all sides scorched the land to defeat one another. The Great War came to an abrupt end as the magic that had been so plenteous in the past had mysteriously vanished. The only magic left to the people was that which was bound to certain relics. These powerful items are scattered throughout the world of Santum and Guilds pay handsome sums of gold to those willing to pluck them from obscurities grasp. Some seek them for power, while others attempt to keep them from falling into the wrong hands.

Relic Quest is a fantasy quest and dungeon crawler with simple mechanics for the entire family to enjoy:

     Single and Multiplayer as well as other modes of play.
     Character Development based on a simple level system.
     Immersive world and game play.


—description from publisher

Name: Abbadon's Gate Trading Card Game
Description:
Abbadon's Gate Trading Card Game is a multi-dimensional trading card game that fuses collectible playing cards with tabletop elements such as dice and a multi-tiered battlefield for limitless amounts of strategy development, deck customization and hours of fun.

In a game of Abaddon's Gate, your goal is to use a combination of Character, Attack, Defense and Item Cards to develop a battle strategy to advance across the battlefield and defeat your opponent by reducing their Health Points to zero. You can also obtain special Quest Cards that can help turn the tide of the game and help you reign as champion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Saxophone Promo Card
Description:
A promo card originally available through Game Boy Geek's 2021 Kickstarter campaign.
Text on the card: Use the effect on the silver side of any or all [Assistant Tile] available on the supply board.

Name: Mur
Description:
Mur is an abstract strategy board game for two players, which was invented by Canadian, Desmond R Davies, in Atlantic Canada in 2021. The concept behind Mur's game design draws inspiration from the book of Genesis. The Mur board is a round grid with 25 intersections and the playing pieces are small checkers engraved with ancient galleys making the game set reminiscent of the ancient city of Atlantis as described by Plato in his Critias dialogue.

There are a total of 15 game pieces: 14 ships and one kraken. Seven ships are black and belong to the first player, seven ships are white and belong to the second player, and one piece—the kraken—is red and is a neutral piece. During a turn a player may either place, move or (if forced) withdraw a ship. Since there is no capturing and therefore no permanent elimination of material or territory, the game of Mur functions as a perpetually shifting puzzle. A ship forced into or found in a surrounded solitary position, which is called a trap, must be removed from the board by the owner, not the opponent. The goal of the game is to be the first player to surround the kraken OR acquire three ship traps. Visit murfederation.com to learn more!

-description from designer

Name: The Rival Networks: Game Shows & Documentaries
Description:
This mini-expansion will consist of 8 new Shows - 4 Documentaries and 4 Game Shows - with new art and different Genre Bonuses than the other Shows.

It came separately, in its own baggie, outside of the game box. This module will not come with retail versions of the game, but it will be available online and at conventions after the game comes out.

—description from the Kickstarter campaign

Name: Age of Dogfights: 1920s
Description:
This expansion includes 41 aircraft from the post war 1920s providing 82 aircraft tokens.

The choice of planes is large and players can combine airplanes from the basic game (and other expansions) with airplanes from the '20s. 
There were no major wars between countries then, so players will have to decide which planes will adversaries and participate in battle on which side.

Some of these aircraft were faster and had a higher ceiling, so extra levl 6 and level 7 altitude stands are included.
In addition to describing the characteristics of the aircraft, the rulebook contains a couple of scenarios.
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: The Showdown: Cowboys and Bandits
Description:
The Showdown is a one versus one strategy card game. Pick your side, the Sheriff or the Outlaws and use their unique strategies to stomp your opponent. The Sheriff likes to focus on teaming up with other cowboys to group up and save the day, while the Outlaws will use any dirty tactics they can to win. The Showdown is a deck builder that allows you to think on the fly. Use cowboys or bandits to attack your opponents life total. Whoever's life total hits zero first loses! Use gold to buy cards from the black market and craft your win condition on the fly!

—description from the description

Name: Pierian Court
Description:
The Royal Bard is Dead!

Hark ye! By Decree of the Monarchy, all who seek to become the Royal Bard shall gather in court to test words and wits. Don't be a bum, whether rhyme or hum, and weave a tale sending your competitors in fits!

In Pierian Court, you and your fellow players act as poets competing for the coveted role of Royal Bard. You take turns playing word cards, completing poems by fulfilling specific poetry style criteria. Once completed, you perform your poem for the Court! After being read aloud, your peers then judge for quality and performance. You receive points based on votes. Whoever obtains the most points at the end of the game wins! Congrats ye Royal Bard!

—description from designer

Name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls Requiem
Description:
Return to Mom's basement in this vast expansion to The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls! Expand your experience with a brand new Solitaire mode or Co-Op Mode. With more than 250 new cards, replay is almost endless.

The roster of characters is now greater than ever with the addition of Tainted characters. They'll be exploring the brand-new optional Room Deck for advanced play, which offers global modifiers for players, either cursing or blessing them with powerful effects as they fight to survive. It's not all doom and gloom though, charmed enemies turn foes into friends as players race to be the first to acquire Four Souls.

The Game includes:
- 61 Room Cards for Advanced Play
- 54 Loot Cards
- 50 Treasure Cards
- 54 Monster Cards
- 5 Bonus Souls for Advanced Play
- 22 Character Cards and 22 Starting Items

Name: Host Your Own Murder Mystery: At the Theatre
Description:
Dastardly deeds have been taking place at the Full House Theatre. Can your guests work out whodunnit? Host a thrilling murder mystery night, the perfect addition to your 1920s themed dinner party.

Play with a group of  5 to 12 people and re-playable as our Murder Mystery set has 3 alternative endings! Also playable via video call or Zoom by mailing the components in advance or adapting the usual game play.

The characters are an equal mix of genders, but it does not matter if your guest plays a man or a woman. 
There is a specific character for the host to play (Alex Cited - the host is not a suspect but still a participant!) and the victim is not one of your guests - pages 3 & 4 of the instruction booklet gives more detail.

—description from the publisher

Name: Calling All Knights
Description:
Calling all Knights is a 2-5 player trick-taking card game for the whole family.

Players act as potential rulers of the kingdom trying to rid the land of pesky monsters. They do this by hiring Knights to fight on their behalf and claim bounties. There are 54 different unique looking knight characters making up the knight deck. For each monster on the field, players send one of their knights out to battle. The best knight slays the beast and gets points for the player.

Monsters are slain by the knight with the highest number. If the knight matches the color of the monster, they trump the other knights of a different color. Monster point values are based on how impressed the villagers are. For example, dragons are worth the most at 4 points each. However, if you slay the bunny, that's negative 4. They just don't realize that the bunny is the most dangerous of them all.

The game is played in 5 rounds. The game starts with each player having 2 knights per hand, but that amount increases by 2 each round with the final round having 10 cards in each players' hands. Each round players bid on how many monsters they will take. If they guess correctly, they get extra points. Bonus points increase each round as it gets more difficult to predict. At the end of the last round, whoever scored the highest wins.

Name: Tyrants of the Underdark: Board Game
Description:
Tyrants of the Underdark is a territory control game with a deck-building element.

Each player leads a house of Drow in a section of the Underdark below the Sword Coast. The Drow house is represented by a deck of cards, with each card being a minion in that player's deck. Each minion belongs to one of five aspects of Drow society, and those aspects correspond to different strategies in the game, e.g., malice minions excel at assassinating opponents' troops, while ambition minions are best at recruiting additional minions and promoting minions to your "inner circle", which is a special zone that increases their value at the end of the game.

When you set up the game, you create an 80-card deck by shuffling two 40-card half-decks together, with the half-decks being Drow, Dragons, Demons, and Elementals.

A central marketplace has new minions that can be recruited through influence, one of two resources in the game; purchased cards are placed in your discard pile, then shuffled together with other cards in your deck when needed. The other resource is power, which allows you to place troops on the game board, expand your forces across the map of the Underdark, manipulate happenings in the city, and assassinate enemy troops.

Players gain points by controlling sites, recruiting valuable minions, promoting minions to your inner circle, and assassinating troops, and whoever ends the game with the most points wins.

NOTE: This 2021 printing includes the Aberrations & Undead expansion.

Name: UFO Wave: The Tactical Card Game Of Alien Supremacy
Description:
UFO Wave is a competitive resource gathering card game entirely themed on the UFO subject! Players take on the role of an alien species visiting Earth. You are tasked with performing activities and absorbing energy. Use your advanced powers and craft to get the better of your opponents and avoid groups of interfering humans!

Created by an active UFO Investigator from the UK, and with quirky cartoon artwork by a real UFO witness from the USA, it's one of the most authentic portrayals of the subject ever released in tabletop game form!

The game features a very unusual card mechanic. It has been designed from the ground up to be fun and accessible, and you do not have to have an interest in the UFO subject to enjoy it. However if you do, there's loads you'll be able to relate to.

It's time to release your inner alien and join the UFO Wave!

—description from the designer

Name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The epic Egyptian game Kemet is reborn with a new revised edition!

With Kemet: Blood and Sand, immerse yourself in a more realistic Ancient Egypt. Here, Gods are powerful, masters of both the desert and the Nile delta. They challenge each other in violent battles and show no mercy. Get ready to become an Egyptian God, open the gates of your city, and let your troops sing the song of war to please you and claim your dominance as master of Ancient Egypt.

Kemet: Blood and Sand features new art and upgraded gameplay with new approachable rules that go beyond the 1.5 version of Kemet developed with the help of the BGG community. Free from the constraints of existing components, designers Jacques Bariot and Guillaume Montiage go even further in fine-tuning the Kemet experience.

The game also features a redesigned map with a twist, bigger and more detailed figurines, and other surprises.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Cemetery
Description:
Shovels and Tombs, rotten Corpses and Zombies, the life of an undertaker is plenty of dangers.

Keeping your cemetery in check is a challenging job!

First, you need to bury corpses, then you need to keep them buried! 
You can’t rest a minute.
Tombs are scarce and you may just think to bury corpses in any tomb, but don’t be fooled, these are the corpses that will haunt you! As soon as you think you may keep your dirty deeds in the ground, someone could just exhume a corpse and let you end up with a zombie in your cemetery!

It’s a dirty job, but someone has to do it!

The Cemetery is a cynical fast-paced game, easy to learn and fun to play where you cover the role of an Undertaker and your job is to bury corpses 3 meters under. 
Each corpse has a value and until their tombs are sealed you need to watch out! Your opponents can exhume your corpses and rise a zombie in your cemetery! 
All corpses in sealed tombs are your Victory Points.

Every card holds an ability, choose which to bury and which to use to support your plan and undermine your opponents', Developments can help you find the finest strategy to achieve victory.

Strategically intriguing for the savvier players, The Cemetery with its minimalist design is suitable for everyone thanks also to the alternative easy setup for the youngest players.

Beautifully illustrated by Agni Sen (has worked on Disney and Nickelodeon animated shows), The Cemetery comes in 2 versions, “original edition” and “Pet edition” that combined can be played by up to 8 people.

Your dream finally comes true… You are now in charge of the afterlife!

Grab your shovel, start digging, and build the most fun Cemetery in Town.

Name: Widget Ridge: WALKABOUT
Description: Widget Ridge: WALKABOUT is a 15-card expansion that includes invention cards as well as a new card type Locations. Cards can be combined with the Widget Ridge starter set.

Name: Das Natur Spiel
Description:
Players earn the right to move their pawns by answering questions about nature (water, plants, sun) correctly. Movement is done by a die roll. Players want to arrive at 3 special points on the grid track to collect 3 different certificates. Opposing pawns may be temporarily blocked or moved back.
Whoever collects 3 cerfificates wins the game.

Name: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Secrets & Soirees Expansion
Description:
The king is throwing a party and inviting all the neighbors! This expansion to Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig expands the game up to 8 players with two new room types (activity and secret rooms), a new specialty room type (ballrooms), more bonus cards, and a new throne room.

Would you rather party alone? This box also includes an Automa solo mode for the base game and the expansion, as well as optional rules for a new mode of play for 2-8 players in which you build your own castle instead of sharing one with your neighbors.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig
Game: Castles of Mad King Ludwig

Name: Gare aux Relous
Description:
Gare aux Relous is the new game from the Freaky 42! A fun game based on auctions and bluff where the goal is to get rid of the jerks that ruin the party for everybody... Will you be able to shake them off, or will you be forced to suffer them ?

In order to reduce our carbon footprint and shorten our distribution circuit, the game will only be available in French.

—description from the publisher

Name: Genotype: Fellowship Hall Promo Cards
Description:
Part of the Tantrum House Season 7 Kickstarter, contains 2 cards of the same kind:

Fellowship Hall

You may activate this Tool when another player validates a Trait to validate the same Trait

Name: ヒモトキ (Himotoki)
Description:
ãƒ’ãƒ¢ãƒˆã‚­ (Himotoki) is a 2 player abstract game from Japan. Players thread a cord through holes in a board that stands between them, so that polygon shapes are formed on both sides. With only ever seeing one side, the first player to successfully declare that they have made exactly four polygons, combining the shapes made on both sides, is the winner.

The board is 21cms square, and shows a pentagon pattern on both sides, with a hole at each point and another hole in the centre. The players hold the board up between them, and take turns to thread the red cord back and forth between the holes. In doing so, the thread starts to outline small shapes, triangles and polygons, as it criss-crosses itself.

Players must use deduction and understand the patterns they can't see, so that when exactly four shapes are made, they can declare and win the game.

By passing the cord through the same hole twice or more, it might confuse the other player as to how the shapes are being formed.

If the players think that too many shapes have been made, they can declare and start over, with no winner that time.
user summary

Name: September's Corsair's: The Thompson Trophy Races, 1946-1949
Description:
Following the outbreak of another world war in September 1939 the National Air Races, including its showpiece Thompson Trophy race, were suspended for the duration of the war. In September 1946 the National Air Races were back, now under the leadership of the Cleveland Air Foundation. The Thompson Trophy races, however, were changed from those of the pre-war era. Gone were the racers built by private aircraft corporations or made by designer pilot craftsmen. In their places were war surplus fighter planes stripped of their armaments and modified for even more horsepower. The modified Corsairs, Air Cobras, Mustangs and Lightnings were flown almost exclusively by a younger generation of pilots groomed by wartime training and experience. With no limits and few rules, the post war Thompson Trophy races portended for those who sat in a brand new purpose-built grandstand even greater thrilling aerial spectacles than those witnessed seven years before.

Each copy of September’s Corsairs is composed of the following:

•    17x pilot cards
•    14x plane cards
•    14x die cut aircraft units
•    1x die cut 1946-1949 “Pack” unit
•    6x course balloon markers
•    One 8 page rules and scenario booklet

Please note that September' Eagles is required to play September's Corsairs.

-description from designer

Name: 信仰通貨 (The Faith Of Currencies)
Description:
ä¿¡ä»°é€šè²¨ (The Faith Of Currencies) is a game from Japan, where players are currency traders trying to maximise their wealth. But the value of the currency depends on how much faith each trader has in the religions. Players are trying to promote the worship of one deity, whilst also preparing to switch allegiances if the deity falls from favour.

The game has a market board to show the relative exchange rates, and a track board to show how the faith is fluctuating, using small cubes for each religion (the rulebook is called Prayer's Guide).

There is a deck of cards which is used to calculate the player's score at the end of the game. At the start of the game, two cards are dealt up to move two prices. Then the deck is shuffled and players are dealt three cards. Four more cards are dealt up to form a draft.

The game has a huge stack of crisp bank notes, beautifully illustrated in the style of real banknotes, to represent each religion. The Esoteric Order Of Dagon is the US dollar, and the Euro (Zeus), Yen (Amariti) and Yuan (Communism) are also used, along with a Flying Spaghetti Monster coin (banknote). The backs of the notes are blanked, so players cannot know what anybody is holding. Players are dealt two notes of each of the five types at the start.

The game is played over a series of rounds, one more than the number of players. In a round, a player may trade currencies with the bank, or change their faith, or adjust the market prices.

When a player trades currencies, they sell what they want from their supply and buy from the bank at the current rates. The number of banknotes exchanged then alters the faith in each currency.

For example, a player might sell 2 Communism at 12 each, and buy 3 Amariti at 8 each. This moves the Communism cube along the faith track two places, and the Amariti cube moves three places. The Communism cube is now on a +1 space, so the price rises to 13. The Amariti cube is now on a +/-2 space, so the player can move the price up or down two places, for example up to 10.

Moving these cubes triggers the round ending. When a faith cube has lapped and reached its starting point, the day's trading ends and a new round starts.

A player can change their faith by discarding and drawing cards from the open supply or the top of the deck. Each religious card shows an effect on the value, dependent on the number of cards held (1,2 or 3). The value of the religion is based upon different factors, such as how much the price is, or how much total currency is held, or for the FSM, how many sets of notes you can form.

The final action a player can take is simply to move a faith cube, and adjust the market price accordingly.

Players continue to take turns carrying out these actions, until the round ends, and after the final round ends, players calculate their scores. A player's score depends on how many of which faith card they hold, and the relative prices, and how many banknotes they hold. Once calculated, the player with the most points wins.

By the open trading of banknotes and open adjusting of prices, other player's might deduce what hidden faith cards a player holds. But a player could be bluffing and trying to manipulate the market whilst holding different faiths in their hand. As the market develops, a player will want to switch their faith to maximise their final score.
user summary

Name: The Pure Land: Ōnin War in Muromachi Japan, 1465-1477
Description:
The Pure Land: ÅŒnin War in Muromachi Japan, 1465-1477 is Volume XIV of the COIN Series originally designed by Volko Ruhnke. It depicts a devastating civil war in 15th century Japan that reduced Kyoto to a smoldering ruin and precipitated the century-long warring states period—the Sengoku Jidai. Against the backdrop of this civil war between coalitions led by the Hosokawa and Yamana clan, the game also features peasant revolts led by the Jizamurai and religious unrest involving the IkkÅ-ikki, the militant wing of the emerging JÅdo ShinshÅ« (or True Pure Land) Buddhist sect.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Kamakura Period to Muromachi Period

Name: What the What?!: The Party Game Reinvented
Description:
WHAT THE WHAT?! is a 3-10 person party game where players compete to invent outrageous new uses for genuine old-time inventions. Featuring audacious attempts, fantastic fails, and kooky contraptions from the world’s patent archives.

It’s easy to play. The Investor reveals an illustrated invention card. Players become the Inventor and channel their inner hustler, comedian, and entrepreneur to pitch the most outrageous - or accurate - explanation of WHAT THE WHAT?!! is that?

How To Play
At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt 10 Pitch Prompt cards. Take one Invention Card and place it on the table. The Investor acts like a judge and the remaining players are Inventors, whose job it is to pitch these oddball inventions and impress the Investor to score points.

Inventors have 1-minute to write down their pitches or select one of their Pitch Prompt cards to use as a basis for their pitch.

“What you need when…” or “For people who….” or, “A device for...”

The Investor hands out points and turns the inventions over and reads the back of the card, revealing information about the invention. The next player to the left becomes the next Investor, and so on until every player, in turn, has been the Investor once.

Game over!

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Winter Solstice Lucy
Description:
Promo Pattern and Gear card that were included with the Winter Solistice Lucy.

The Winter Solistice Lucy kit comes with 2 miniatures. A 54mm scale model perfect for painters and a 35mm scale model for gamers looking for a fun survivor stand-in for their springtime gaming session. It also includes the Grim Muffler pattern and gear cards.

Name: Smurfs: The Lost Village
Description:
Can you find the lost village before the other Smurfs?

The race is on to find the lost village. Smurfs must try to stay ahead from other Smurfs by taking shortcuts and double moves. But watch out for Gargamel and Azrael, as they will set you back in your quest.

—description from the back of the box

Smurfs The Lost Village Board Game is a great way to have fun with kids.  Simple colour-based game mechanics are easy to learn, and with shortcuts and hazards along the way, the path to the lost village is more fun than ever!

—description from the publisher

Name: HEXplore It: Hero Chest
Description:
A storage chest that also includes with new game play content.

This box has three independent containers inside and will comfortably hold all Roles, Races, Traits, and Legendary cards that are planned to be released.

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Valley of the Dead King – Klik's Madness Campaign Book
Description:
This choose-your-own-path, board game/novel hybrid, is an ambitious product whose story takes place in the Runecrest Valley, before the Dead King arrives. Play through the Valley of the Dead King (Volume I) in an entirely new way and experience the unfolding of a complex and epic story. Your heroes will be pulled into the narrative and will drive how the story unfolds based on the decisions and actions you make.

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Valley of the Dead King – Living Card Deck
Description:
Continue your adventure in the Runecrest Valley! The content in this deck box requires the use of the Valley of the Dead King Core box.

Add 60 new cards to supplement the Valley of the Dead King Core Box.

12 Circumstances: Experience new Encounters, Treasures, Nature effects and more.

24 Quests: Play through a twelve-card Quest arc that brings a rich story to life that unravels quickly during play. Additionally, you'll find 12 independent Quests to help the quirky gnome Bezzelquark.

24 Peril Cards: Newly introduced in this deck, these dangerous cards initiate challenging scenarios for the heroes to overcome and offer huge rewards to those who can!

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Valley of the Dead King – Encounter Deck
Description:
This Encounter Deck adds a new way to play the Valley of the Dead King. All previously existing encounters from the Core Box, the Expansion, and the Living Card deck are reprinted with epic new art!

These decks add a new way to play the game by separating the Encounters into their own deck. Additionally, these encounters are not restricted to the volume they originally appeared in, allowing you to add and customize what encounters will appear in any volume you play.

Contents include:

Rules insert describing this new playstyle 
32 Full art encounters

Boons offer new and increased rewards on the next Encounter you face!

Game Difficulty increase cards. Each deck will come with 3 Game Difficulty increase cards.

Conditions/Keyword list: Add conditions that appeared exclusively in certain volumes to any game.

Role variations: updated rules for the Roles who Summon Encounters

How do Boons work exactly?
Boons are newly introduced in Domain of Mirza Noctis. When you draw one of these from the Encounter deck, you’ll draw another card. If it is another Boon, you keep drawing. If the last card drawn is an Encounter, you’ll gain extra rewards after battle. If the card is not an Encounter(a difficulty increase for instance), you’ll shuffle the Boons back into the Encounter deck. Boons offer new and increased rewards!

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Forests of Adrimon – Living Card Deck
Description:
Continue your adventure in the Greenfire Forest! The content in this deck box requires the use of the Forests of Adrimon Core box.

Add 60 new cards to supplement the Forests of Adrimon Core Box.

24 Circumstances: Experience new Encounters, Treasures, Nature effects and more.

12 Destinations: Play through a twelve-card Destination arc that brings a rich story to life that unravels quickly during play.

24 Peril Cards: Newly introduced in this deck, these dangerous cards initiate challenging scenarios for the heroes to overcome and offer huge rewards to those who can!

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Forests of Adrimon – Encounter Deck
Description:
This Encounter Deck adds a new way to play The Forests of Adrimon. All previously existing encounters from the Core Box, the Expansion, and the Living Card deck are reprinted with epic new art!

These decks add a new way to play the game by separating the Encounters into their own deck. Additionally, these encounters are not restricted to the volume they originally appeared in, allowing you to add and customize what encounters will appear in any volume you play.

Contents include:

Rules insert describing this new playstyle

34 Full art encounters

Boons offer new and increased rewards on the next Encounter you face!

Game Difficulty increase cards. Each deck will come with 3 Game Difficulty increase cards.

Conditions/Keyword list: Add conditions that appeared exclusively in certain volumes to any game.

Role variations: updated rules for the Roles who Summon Encounters

How do Boons work exactly?
Boons are newly introduced in Domain of Mirza Noctis. When you draw one of these from the Encounter deck, you’ll draw another card. If it is another Boon, you keep drawing. If the last card drawn is an Encounter, you’ll gain extra rewards after battle. If the card is not an Encounter(a difficulty increase for instance), you’ll shuffle the Boons back into the Encounter deck. Boons offer new and increased rewards!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Shark Hunt
Description:
In Shark Hunt!, you and your friends are patrolling the beach for sharks that have been taking bites out of the beachgoers. You will roll a die that will indicate the movement of the sharks. Then, all the hunters will move their boats in pursuit. If a shark reaches a boat, the shark attacks and attempts to sink the boat, gaining points for the sharks! If a boat reaches a shark, the hunter attempts to capture the shark, gaining points for that hunter! If a shark makes it to the coast, they attack a beachgoer, gaining points for the sharks! It is a battle for beachfront supremacy!

—description from the publisher

Name: HEXplore It: The Sands of Shurax – Living Card Deck
Description:
Continue your adventure in the wastelands of Shurax! The content in this deck box requires the use of the Sands of Shurax Core box.

Add 60 new cards to supplement the Sands of Shurax Core Box.

12 Circumstances: Experience new Encounters, Treasures, Nature effects and more.

24 Missions: Play through two twelve-card Mission arcs that brings a rich story to life that unravels quickly during play.

24 Peril Cards: Newly introduced in this deck, these dangerous cards initiate challenging scenarios for the heroes to overcome and offer huge rewards to those who can!

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Sands of Shurax – Encounter Deck
Description:
This Encounter Deck adds a new way to play The Sands of Shurax. All previously existing encounters from the Core Box, the Expansion, and the Living Card deck are reprinted with epic new art!

These decks add a new way to play the game by separating the Encounters into their own deck. Additionally, these encounters are not restricted to the volume they originally appeared in, allowing you to add and customize what encounters will appear in any volume you play.

Contents include:

Rules insert describing this new playstyle

33 Full art encounters

Boons offer new and increased rewards on the next Encounter you face!

Game Difficulty increase cards. Each deck will come with 3 Game Difficulty increase cards.

Conditions/Keyword list: Add conditions that appeared exclusively in certain volumes to any game.

Role variations: updated rules for the Roles who Summon Encounters

How do Boons work exactly?
Boons are newly introduced in Domain of Mirza Noctis. When you draw one of these from the Encounter deck, you’ll draw another card. If it is another Boon, you keep drawing. If the last card drawn is an Encounter, you’ll gain extra rewards after battle. If the card is not an Encounter(a difficulty increase for instance), you’ll shuffle the Boons back into the Encounter deck. Boons offer new and increased rewards!

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Domain of Mirza Noctis – Living Card Deck
Description:
Continue your adventure in the harrowing realm of Krasvetelia. The content in this deck box requires the use of the Domain of Mirza Noctis Core box.

Add 60 new cards to supplement the Domain of Mirza Noctis Core Box.

12 What is This? Day Cards: Experience new Encounters, Treasures, Nature effects, Escorts, and more.

12 What was That? Night Cards: Just like the "What is This" living cards, gain several new experiences to augment your nightly travels.

12 From on High Investigation Arc: Play through a twelve-card Investigation arc that follows an Angel as he investigates the disappearance of one of his allies. Will he too, succumb to Noctis's influence, or will you save a fallen angel?

12 Blood Ties Investigation Arc: Play through a twelve-card Investigation arc that brings you dangerously close to Noctis's blood collectors. Find out what they're doing and how they're doing it as this dark story unfolds.

12 Encounters: Add new illustrated Encounters to your core box.

-description from publisher's website

Name: HEXplore It: The Domain of Mirza Noctis – Return to the Domain of Mirza Noctis
Description:
This expansion presents a future timeline for your heroes — what happens when Noctis succeeds?

The dark lord has gathered the blood needed for his ritual and has ascended to godhood. But his goal of ascension wasn’t what people thought it would be. His hostility against the commoners of the land has eerily ceased. New, terrible horrors have arrived in the land of Krasvetelia, seeking to tear it asunder. Did he summon them? Or was he preparing for this eventuality all along? Noctis may be the only one strong enough to stand against these horrors. But did he gather enough power, or will he succumb to these titanic forces from another plane of existence? Only your heroes can help shape Krasvetelia’s destiny.

The Horrors have arrived.
Tragedy. Calamity. Disaster. Cataclysm. Forge an entirely new journey in the darkening land of Krasvetelia and gather power as quickly as you can to stop the four terrible horrors that have appeared in the world. You’ll face each, in a different order each time you play. Your only ally is Noctis himself, but can you keep your sanity, or will you succumb to madness?

What does this Expansion add?

3 new epic Roles and 11 powerful Races to add to your collection (perfect for solo and small group play!)

4 variable level Horrors - face them in a different order and experience contrasting effects each time you play

Madness - Your heroes will accumulate Madness, but can you keep your sanity long enough?

Epic Power Ups, Encounters, Investigations, Events, Treasures, and more for each of your Core box card decks

Mythic Legendary Items and Allies

New Keepsakes to keep your heroes going after death

A new punchboard for your map that interacts uniquely with the four Horrors

-description from publisher's website

Name: Aventuria: Al'anfanian Blessed One of Boron
Description:
This pack of 55 cards presents you the new heroine Zephira Golgarez, an Al'Anfan Blessed One to Boron. The pack contains hero cards, talent cards, a life card, the starting hero deck of 30 action cards and the 18 cards from the heroine's wealth of experience, which are used in connection with the Aventuria legends mode.

Dieser Kartenpack aus 55 Karten präsentiert euch die neue Heldin Zephira Golgarez, eine al'anfanische Borongeweihte. Im Pack enthalten sind Heldenkarten, Talentkarten, eine Lebenspunkte-Karte, das Start-Heldendeck aus 30 Aktionskarten sowie die 18 Karten des Erfahrungsschatzes der Heldin, die im Zusammenhang mit dem Aventuria Legendenmodus zum Einsatz kommen.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Garethian Double Mercenary
Description:
This pack of 55 cards presents you the new hero Geron Orphan Maker, a Garethic double mercenary. The pack contains hero cards, talent cards, a life card, the starting hero deck of 30 action cards and the 18 cards from the hero's wealth of experience, which are used in connection with the Aventuria legends mode.

Dieser Kartenpack aus 55 Karten präsentiert euch den neuen Helden Geron Waisenmacher, einen garethischen Doppelsöldner. Im Pack enthalten sind Heldenkarten, Talentkarten, eine Lebenspunkte-Karte, das Start-Heldendeck aus 30 Aktionskarten sowie die 18 Karten des Erfahrungsschatzes des Helden, die im Zusammenhang mit dem Aventuria Legendenmodus zum Einsatz kommen.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Mythische Geschichten
Description:
The central element of this supplementary box is a handy little booklet with two new adventures - Under the Northern Lights and The Streuner Shall Die - as well as “Director's Cut” versions (significantly more extensive versions) of well-known adventures such as The Legacy of Wildenstein, Forest Without Return and Ship of Lost Souls. All of these adventures use the new Aventuria story mode featured in the box. A number of story mode playing cards are also included.

The story mode can be played in combination with the legend mode or independently.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das zentrale Element dieser Ergänzungs-Box ist ein handliches Büchlein mit zwei neuen Abenteuern – Unter dem Nordlicht und Der Streuner soll sterben – sowie „Director's Cut“-Versionen (also deutlich umfangreichere Versionen) altbekannter Abenteuer wie Das Erbe von Wildenstein, Wald ohne Wiederkehr und Schiff der Verlorenen Seelen. Alle diese Abenteuer verwenden den neuen Aventuria-Geschichtenmodus, der in der Box vorgestellt wird. Zudem sind eine Reihe von Spielkarten für den Geschichtenmodus enthalten.

Der Geschichtenmodus kann in Kombination mit dem Legendenmodus gespielt werden oder unabhängig davon.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Pfad der Legenden
Description:
In this oversized extension box, we present the new Aventuria legends mode with around 600 cards. Here your heroes finally have the opportunity to travel to the nearest settlement after an adventure and invest their hard-earned adventure points in new, improved cards. This makes every hero and heroine not only stronger and more powerful, but also a real Aventurian legend with a very individual hero deck and many special abilities.

When designing the legend mode, we paid particular attention to making it interesting for beginners and casual gamers, so that every Aventuria player really gets something out of it.

—description from the publisher (translated)

In dieser übergroßen Ergänzungs-Box präsentieren wir euch mit rund 600 Karten den neuen Aventuria-Legendenmodus. Hier haben eure Helden nun endlich die Gelegenheit, nach einem Abenteuer in die nächstgelegene Siedlung zu reisen und ihre hart verdienten Abenteuerpunkte in neue, verbesserte Karten zu investieren. Dadurch wird jeder Held und jede Heldin nicht nur stärker und mächtiger, sondern auch zu einer echten aventurischen Legende mit einem ganz individuellen Heldendeck und vielen besonderen Fähigkeiten.

Wir haben beim Entwurf des Legendenmodus ganz besonderen Wert darauf gelegt, ihn auch für Spieleinsteiger und Gelegenheitsspieler interessant zu machen, damit wirklich jeder Aventuria-Spieler etwas davon hat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Mythen & Legenden Bonus-Box
Description:
This box contains all stretch goals of the Mythen & Legenden Kickstarter crowdfunded expansion including new alternate gender heroes.

It contains 220 cards (alternative heroes, trait cards, new minions, leader actions, events, hero titles and much more)
and Die cut sheet with 12 hero stamps
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Golem Races
Description:
Ruparstein is a land that didn’t stand out from the rest of the world until their rulers decided to export their national entertainment: the golem races. Nowadays it’s a very widespread sport with lots of racers and an anxious and unconditional audience. Skilful gnomes prepare their iron golems, necromants stitch up bodies together to create their ultimate flesh golem, dwarven conjurers sculpt stone to give birth a solid runner, and a hundred other participants wait for their call to the start line. The best runners have been called. It is now the time to make your coach a rich man and to catapult him to golem’s glory.
—description from the rulebook

The game is played by a referee and multiple racers.  Players create individual golems, primarily by random roll.  Play then proceeds in turns, each turn spans four distinct phases.  During Phase 1, players determine initiative (who will go first that turn.  During Phase 2, players move their pieces in initiative order.  During Phase 3, players check for mechanical problems.  During Phase 4, the referee adjusts the board as needed.  The game ends when the first player - the winner - crosses the finish line.

The game is provided as a PDF rules document with suggestions on common items that can be used as game components.

—user summary

Name: Cra Diavolo, or, "That Ferocious and Insolent Toad"
Description:
Brigand or Patriot? Sworn enemy of King Tadio Polo and his Ferach allies, the legendary Cra Diavolo is the focus of resistance against the sovereign of Nepolise. Let Todoroni rebels join battle!

An unofficial expansion for Flintloque Reloaded.

—description from the rulebook

Name: The Guns of Cra Diavolo, or, "The artillery of King Polo takes flight"
Description:
"Remember to act with surprise and strike suddenly.  We must destroy the King's guns without fail."

        - Cra Diavolo


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded, for two players.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Run Like the Wind, or, "Flight is the best defense"
Description:
"As my old Sarge used to say back in the Witchlands; ‘He who fights and runs away, lives to fight another day’."

        - Cra Diavolo


Flintloque Reloaded Scenario (for two players)

—description from the rulebook

Name: The Devil's Roost, or, "When the going gets tough, the tough get going"
Description:
"Messieurs, today you have the opportunity to make a great service to our country, or to die in the attempt."

        - Generale Champignon


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded for two, three, or four players.

—description from the rulebook

Name: By the Shimmering Sea, or, "Three Orcs in a Boat (To Say Nothing of the Dog)"
Description:
"Well blow me down and gouge out me eye if them ain't pansy elves in them girly uniforms yonder!"

        - Marine Jack Tarr


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded (for two or three players).

Name: Flames of War: Missions Pack
Description:
With the rulebook now adopting the revised victory conditions from the old More Missions pack, we've updated it (now just called the Missions pack) to reflect this. We've also added the missions from the Experimental Missions pack as well, consolidating them all in one place. Includes 6 print and play cards.

The pack contains Twenty missions: • Annihilation • Breakthrough • Bridgehead • Contact • Cornered • Counterattack • Dust Up • Dogfight • Encounter • Encirclement •  Encounter •  Escape • Free For All • Escape  • Fighting Withdrawl • Free for All • Gauntlet • Killing Ground • No Retreat • Outflanked • Scouts Out •  Spearpoint •  Vanguard •

Each mission has a double page telling you how to play the mission and detailing the mission special rules. You can either print each mission out on a single piece of paper (front and back) or print it as a booklet with each mission on facing pages.

The Battle Plans mission selector allow you and your opponent to choose the most appropriate missions for your forces. Each player chooses a plan (Prepared Attack, Hasty Attack, or Defend) and then you look up a table to see which mission to play and who will be the attacker.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magna Roma: Dominus
Description:
In Dominus, players will be fighting for control of the Europe and North African territories. To do this, players will be able to either use the military symbols combination or the prestige symbol combination.

Players will do this until the end of the game, and the player with the majority of armies in a territory, will win the first place in that territory and score most for whatever the condition is in that territory. We should also note that this board replaces the military board in the base game.

In Portus, your neighborhoods will be able to craft goods which you can then export from your port!

Once you think you have enough goods for export, you can simply turn over those goods to the supply and score prestige depending on what types of goods you have exported! Sometimes, some goods will cost you population, so you need to plan carefully for such occasion.

Name: Elongo
Description:
Elongo is a colourful and skillful 2-4 player tile game that reflects the life of the Maasai tribes of Kenya and Tanzania.

Players take turns laying 2 tiles and features on the tiles may be claimed or abandoned. Players compete for tile features that allow them to place their Zebu cattle, sheep and goats when features are completed.

The player who places all of their stock of animals in an enclosure is the winner.

—description from publisher

This is a tile laying game. 2 tiles are laid in each players turn, .

Name: Love Links
Description:
Love Links is a 2-4 player game that lets players create and wear bracelets made of precious metals and jewels.

Players place 2 bracelet links during their turn, joining to links already placed by other players according to the properties of links already played.

If a bracelet is completed then the player receives points according to length of the bracelet, the metal in the bracelet, the jewels and its other features. And the player receives the bracelet to wear!

—description from the designer

The player with the most points after all bracelet links have been played wins.

Name: L.A.M.A.: 3 Gry w 1
Description: 3 in 1: L.A.M.A., L.A.M.A. Party Edition and L.A.M.A. Dice

Name: Triple-T
Description:
The game board is nine tic-tac-toe fields in a 3x3 grid. Whoever manages to lay a line of three fields wins - but only one of the nine quadrants. It's not that easy at all: The opponent determines which quadrant you are allowed to play on with his previous move. In this way he can prevent one of his lines from being interrupted.

—user summary

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Hidden Gems Bundle
Description:
The Hidden Gems Bundle is an expansion pack to Cards Against Humanity.

Contains six different themed packs and 10 all-new cards.

Contents: 190 cards total (150 White cards + 40 Black Cards).

Name: Lucky Cat
Description: Collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats in this colourful, cat collecting card game from Ridley's Games! The aim of the game is to collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats before the other players to win a round. The first person to win two rounds wins the game! There are 2 winning combinations of cats: 7 of the same numbered cats in different colours or cats numbered 1-7 of the same colour. Contains instructions, 65 game cards, 4 reference cards, packaged in a novelty Lucky Cat shaped case.

Name: Peter Powell's Pop Trivia
Description:
The Board is a track from 1975 up to Number 1. Players must answer trivia questions on the UK pop scene for 1960 to 1986. Up to 4 players get their own question book. There are 2,500 questions in the game which is a good number and enhances replay ability.
Before the start each player writes down 10 song titles and keeps that secret.

As you move up the board (usually by rolling a die) you will land on one of 9 types of squares.

IN CONCERT - Pick another player. Pick a number from 1 to 10. That player now has to mime the title on his secret list with the number you chose. You get 2 minutes to get the song title.
BLANK SPACE - You are told a question. Get it right, you can have another turn. Get it wrong and you end your turn.
COVER VERSION - Choose another player and select a number from 1 to 10. That player now reveals the song on his list. You must then sing two consecutive lines in the song. Get it right and you get another turn, Get it wrong and you end your turn.
HYPE - Guilty of illegal song placement. End your turn and go back to Start.
BAN - Having a song banned from the radio is a sure sign of selling lots of copies. Move up 10 spaces on the board.
END OF TURN/FREE GO - No question to answer and continue your turn.
REMIX - Ask a question to any other player from your question book. If that player he stays where hew is. If he gets it wrong he moves 6 spaces down the board.
THE TOP TEN - No dice movement. Instead you answer a question correctly to move 1 space up the board. Get it wrong, you stay where you are. If you are on Square Number 2 you must answer 2 consecutive questions to get to Number One. If you get there first, you are the winner.

The game was an advertising item for Pepsi.
Peter Powell (b.1951) was a very popular BBC Disc-Jockey. His image is on the cover.

—user summary

Name: Katzekartonen
Description:
In Katzekartonen, two players compete to end the game with the most cats in the boxes of their color. Play occurs in two phases: first, there is the "Experimental Design." Place boxes of your color into the lab room game board. But be careful, your opponent may place their boxes inside yours, Changing an opportunity for you to score to one for them.

Once all the boxes are placed, it's time for Cat Herding! Try to place more cats in your boxes than your opponent. But cats are tricky, and rarely stay where they're placed! Place a cat beside another, and it will jump to another box, which may cause the next cat to jump, which can cause the next... It could be a whole cascade of chaotic cats. Can you tame the chaos to herd more cats I to your boxes and force your opponent to cause a "Cuckoo Kitty" and end the game?

This game utilizes a unique take on the tile-laying genre by adding a layering component and a secondary movement round. Its "strategic chaos" gameplay makes it fun for veteran "crunchy" players and new gamers alike.

—description from the publisher

Name: 大怪獣ヴェナタス VS 強欲な異能建築家 (Dai kaijuu Venatas vs Goyouku na inou-kenchikuka)
Description:
å¤§æ€ªç£ãƒ´ã‚§ãƒŠã‚¿ã‚¹ VS å¼·æ¬²ãªç•°èƒ½å»ºç¯‰å®¶ (Daikaiju Venatas vs Goyoku na inou-kenchikuka) is a game from Japan with players constructing properties and sending monsters to destroy the opponents' buildings.

Over 6 rounds, players place cubes in the different sectors of the city. As buildings are constructed, the land prices rise in the sectors. Then the players send Godzilla crashing around, which brings down land prices. Then they sell the buildings if they have the matching cards in hand. Unsold buildings stay in place, risking destruction next turn.

There are caps on the number of buildings to be built or sold, and the cap rises over the game.

At the end of the game, the player who's made the most profit is the winner.
user summary

Name: Path of Light and Shadow: Solstice
Description:
After many winters of war, the Realms lay in ruin. The feud of the deposed heirs to the throne has spilled out across the sea, reaching the forgotten shores of the Hinterlands. There in the abandoned cities and broken temples, relics of impossible power await. But so do their keepers, the ancient race Viratis that walk between the light and the shadow.

In this expansion you will explore megalith ruins on a new island, utilize magical relics, and command new forces that move between Cruelty and Mercy for powerful effects.

Inside the box you can find new player cards for existing factions, a new Region deck for the Hinterlands that include the new Viratis faction, and special map Regions that contain powerful Megaliths instead of towers.

The KS campaign also included a URL to a free mini-solo mode: Faraway Invaders.

-description from publisher

Name: The Treasure Trials
Description:
The Treasure Trials are an ancient contest to obtain four keys to unlock the final prize. Treasure hunters will journey through an island jungle while overcoming dangerous trials, uncovering magical artifacts, setting traps, and undoubtedly turning to thievery.

Keys are primarily obtained through mini-game trials such as racing to stack all of your dice, attempting to roll a six within six seconds, and knocking over a tower of dice! You can also obtain keys by buying them off the market with the coins you find or steal.

You group of 2-6 treasure hunters will learn the game quickly, but playstyles will emerge as differing strategies are claimed. Will you protect your coins to buy keys off the market? Hone your skills as a thief? Or seek advantages to aid you in the trials?

—description from the designer

Name: Agents of Kingdom
Description:
What kind of game is it?

The game is played by moving the pieces on the board in the manner of Shogi or Chess. 7 different secret orders are dealt face down, and the player who moves his pieces the fastest to fulfill his secret order wins the game. The secret orders can be as simple as occupying three red squares (which can be occupied by moving pieces and entering red squares), or as complex as having the hero piece, which is one's alter ego, defeated first among all players (usually, the player loses when the hero piece is defeated).

Therefore, for example, if you forcibly aim at a red square that is not necessary, other players may find out about your secret order and interfere with it, and if you unnaturally leave the pieces that protect the heroic pieces empty, they will also find out and it will be difficult to achieve your secret order. The key to the game is how to approach the secret mission secretly and inconspicuously.

The board may be unfavorable, but...

There are two special squares on the board: the red square is a recruiting base and the yellow square is a treasure base. When you occupy a recruiting base, you can add your own pieces to it every turn. When you occupy a treasure base, you can draw strategy cards that allow you to perform special moves such as double moves.

These recruiting bases and treasure bases are the conditions for many secret orders, so you have to guess whether other players are simply occupying them to gain an advantage in the game, or whether they are actually close to achieving their secret orders. Of course, you can use your own pieces and strategy cards to interfere with other players, but it is also very effective to make use of the fact that the secret orders are undisclosed to encourage other players to interfere without getting your hands dirty.

In addition, since all players want to have a useful base of troops and treasure, alliances will be formed early in the game, either by using pieces and strategy cards to fight for the base, or by spontaneously forming alliances to share the base. There are no penalties for betraying alliances, so don't hesitate to betray an alliance if you think you can fulfill a secret order and get closer to victory.

Repeatable and fun!

At the start of the game, in addition to the secret mission card, seven different hero cards are dealt to the player in public, and each of the seven heroes has various characteristics: some are good at power play by sending out many pieces, some are good at trick play by making use of strategy cards, and some are good at slowly accumulating strength in a safe area. Since seven types of secret mission cards are combined with these unique heroes, the fighting style changes every time, so you can enjoy the game for a long time without getting bored.

Also, the initial placement of the hero pieces is determined by the hero cards. It is quite advantageous if the initial placement is close to the base which is the victory condition. However, if other players think that the victory condition is too early, you will be attacked from many directions or receive a concentrated fire of strategy cards, and it is not easy to win. Try to avoid letting your opponent know your victory condition.

On the other hand, you will be at a disadvantage if the base that is the victory condition is far from your initial placement. Use all possible means to achieve a victory on thin ice, such as boldly attacking and destroying the opponent's heroic pieces, making alliances with other players using the opponent with an advantage on the board as a common virtual enemy, or forcing them to fight each other.

—description from the designer

Name: Superfight Superchest
Description: A storage box for Superfight that can contain 1200 cards, and that comes with two hundred new cards.

Name: Random Fun Generator
Description: Random Fun Generator consists of rules for 21 fast-playing dice games. Games are for 2 or more players and require 6-sided dice, as few as 2 total and up to 10 per player. Most games do not require anything beyond a pencil and paper for scoring.
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Diddly
Description:
On a turn, draw a card to replace a card. Match cards to make them worth Diddly. There’s nothing to it!

When a round ends, the points of any unmatched cards are added to your score. The player with the lowest score after five rounds WINS!

But wait, there’s more! (Or is it less?)

Special cards let you peek at your face-down cards, dig through the discard pile, halve the value of a card, or make an instant match.

Look Ma, no hands! Cards are played in front of a player not held in a hand. Diddly is a game the whole family can enjoy.

To win Diddly, stop at nothing… or as close as you can!

-description from designer

Name: A Day in Paris
Description:
You and a friend are visiting Europe, and have different ideas about how to explore Paris’ many tourist attractions in the single day you have. It may sound easy, but Paris is a major city, bustling with tourists and traffic. Your normal means of traversing the connections between attractions is the hop-on-hop-off bus, but if you want to travel faster you can take an expensive taxi from time to time. At each attraction you’ll enjoy spending time exploring, sometimes for a short period and sometimes a longer stay. You’ll be distracted by delicious French pastries, however, and all day long you won’t be able to ignore any patisserie you see. Sip an espresso with your treats, but don’t forget that your goal is to have a better sightseeing experience than your opponent – and both quantity and quality will count toward victory!

GAMEPLAY
On a player’s turn, he/she may take one of the following actions:

• Play one or more cards to travel along the connection lines on the board, from one attraction to another.
• Play one card to explore an attraction.
• Discard one card.

There are three types of connections between attractions: short, medium and long. To move along a connection, a player plays one or more cards from his hand and uses its time symbols to meet the connection’s requirements. Once at an attraction, a player can explore it via melding a matching card from his hand. A few special actions and "long waits" at some attractions add randomness and flavor.

COMPONENTS
•  1 Game Board
• 54 Action Cards
• 20 Wooden Cubes
•  1 Set of Chits
•  2 Player Tokens
•  1 Rules booklet

-description from designer

Name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Twilight Codex Volume II: Affinity
Description:
The Codex is a web-based publication that highlights rules updates and showcases new content for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition and its Prophecy of Kings expansion.

This volume includes:
3 New Relic Cards
Faction Reference Cards
Alliance Reference Cards
Alliance Game Variant
6 Community Designed Maps

Name: Mandora Fever
Description: Mandora Fever is a card game of some sort, and a "mandora" is a mandrake.

Name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: A Cyber Fantasy Solo Skirmish Campaign Game
Description:
Sometimes you just want an elf and a ghoul to go shoot at each other in the cyberized back alleys of neo-berlin.

Welcome to Chrome Hammer Ascension.

In this solo campaign game your gang of punks will attempt to take on the mega-corporations of the ascended world. Dragon CEOs run pharmaceutical companies while flame demons prowl the back alleys and kobold zealots trade shots with an elf hacker.

CHA features a full campaign game where your punks gain experience, find new cool gear and hopefully don't end up face down in a rainy alley when a security guard finally frags them.

Random events, extensive lists of gear and abilities and a huge array of creatures are present in the book, allowing for you to really immerse yourself in the world of cyber fantasy.

The combat system is based on Squad Hammer and Chrome Hammer allowing fast, colorful combat without being bogged down by complex rules, letting you focus on the scenario you are playing and the enemies you are facing down.

Intended from the ground up as a solo game, all you need is a handful of miniatures to get started doing battle on the blood-slick streets, in VR space or the astral plane! Each campaign sees you fighting the mega-corps leading to an epic showdown against their monster CEO.

All of this is supported by included random tables to add flavor to the game experience.

This is a fantastic opportunity to use some figures you have not had a chance to use yet, plan some wild new paint jobs or conversions or bring some beloved old favorites back.


     The core mechanics use a 2D6, pick highest roll to determine how many characters can activate each turn with characters being able to perform an array of actions.
     Ranged combat is resolved with a 2D6 roll trying to exceed a target number, with enemies in close range being permitted to return fire.
     Physical injury, squad casualties and morale is all merged into a single damage score, which can be reduced through the use of certain actions. This allows a fast-playing but tactical feeling experience.
     Mechanics are included for stealth missions, spells and more.



     The rules are intended for solo play and are stand-alone. You do not need a copy of Chrome Hammer or Squad Hammer to play.  
     The intended play space is roughly 3 x 3 feet though smaller tables are manageable. 
     Game scale is agnostic but will play fine in both 15mm and 28mm+. 
     Record sheets are included. 


—description from the publisher

Name: SALBAGE
Description:
SALBAGE is a 2 player abstract postcard game from Japan. The postcard has the rules on one side, and the playing area on the other (two are sold in a pack).

Each player has three dice of their own colour. They take turns rolling and placing the dice on the 3*3 grid. Each space has an instruction, which allow the player to change the dice number or move it around.

The winner is the first player to get all three of their dice to show all odd or all even numbers.
user summary

Name: Hook'em Champ
Description:
Grab some Hooks and swing your pole it’s time for the Hook'em Champ tournament. The lake has been stocked with 9 unique types of fish. Are you up to the challenge? Can you become the next Hook'em Champ?

In Hook'em champ 2-4 players will use dice as hooks. You have 3 actions per turn to Collect, Cast, and Catch. You may Collect Hooks from the Tackle Box, Cast (roll) to determine Depth/Area, and Catch as many fish as you have Hooks/Actions for. As fish are caught, the lake gets restocked. When there are no more fish to stock the lake the tournament will end. Keep an eye out for items and extra ways to get bonuses. Schooling fish with lake sharks can earn a lot of extra bonus points!

The player with the highest points at the end of the game wins. Go Get’em Champ!

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – The Crimson Court
Description:
Prince Duvalle leads the coterie of Soulblight Gravelords known as the Crimson Court, a band of merciless hunters united by their cruel abilities. They found their way into Direchasm through a splint of the spreading Katophrane Curse, intent upon taking full advantage of the rich variety of prey promised by the living mountain's depths.

Claim the mountain in a riot of bloody violence with the Crimson Court. These Soulblight Gravelords introduce a new mechanic called Bloodlust, which you must control if you are to emerge victorious. This set also features a range of universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds.

This set contains:

     4x push-fit Crimson Court miniatures – no glue required to assemble
     4x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Prince Duvalle, Gorath the Enforcer, Vellas von Faine, and Ennias Curse-born
     A further 62 playable cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm, including:
     12x Crimson Court objective cards
     10x Crimson Court upgrade cards
     10x Crimson Court ploy cards
     10x universal objective cards, usable by any warband
     10x universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
     8x universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
     2x universal gambit spell cards, usable by any wizard


—description from the publisher

Name: Rivalen der Piste
Description:
This game is about a Grand Prix race. Every player sports 3 cars. With special dice (all six-sided displaying different numbers for slow, moderate and fast movement) you move your cars. First you choose the dice you want to roll, then you assign the results to your 3 cars. I's a good idea to reduce  speed in track curves to avoid beeing set back. A special effect occurs when rolling a 6 with the moderate die. You roll again and add the result to the previous roll.

Victory points are given for the cars reaching the finish line. The player with the highest score of his 3 cars wins the game.

This game was reimplemented (with several changes and additional rules) in 1988 by PS from Hans im Glück.

—user summary

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Drukhari
Description:
The Drukhari are a decadent race of alien tormentors and raiders. Once part of a galaxy-spanning empire, the Drukhari now indulge in every macabre passion their supreme intelligence can conceive. They consider themselves superior to the galaxy’s other races, and suffer a gnawing sickness of the soul which only the suffering of others can fill. The ranks of the Drukhari are filled with fleet and agile warriors, each armed with weaponry designed to inflict maximum pain, and through their innate poise they raise their torturous form of war into a gruesome artform.

Get ready to launch raids with superior anti-grav vehicles, hideous vat-grown cyborgs, and coteries of venom-shooting killers. Whether you prefer the gang-like cartels of Kabalite Warriors, the gladiatorial Wyches from the arenas or the surgical horror of the Haemonculi (or even a mix of all three!) this book is for you. Along with inspirational photographs of stunningly painted models, it features the background and lore of the Drukhari, and the rules that you need to field them in your games of Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this 120-page codex, you will find:

     The history and dark origins of the Drukhari, their hideous obsessions and the competing factions that vie for power
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel Miniatures that displays the martial liveries, hedonistic colours and gruesome appearances seen among the varied power blocs of Commorragh
     A vast range of datasheets providing tabletop rules for units from the Drukhari army
     Army-wide rules and an evocative Crusade section that allow you to transform your collection of Drukhari miniatures into a terrifying force, poised to strike at the galaxy's vulnerable underbelly and reap the spoils
     And more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Zooloretto: Rainbow Chameleon
Description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, available for free from the designers homepage at Christmas 2020.

This expansion consists of 1 tile with a Rainbow Chameleon.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player who fills his 6-space enclosure takes the Rainbow Chameleon as a bonus.

At the end of the game, the owner of the Rainbow Chameleon can change the color/type of vending stalls, at the cost of 1 coin per vending stall changed. Only the four standard colors/types are available.

Name: Team AG
Description:
Players complete 2 different games one after the other. The first one let the players act in competition to their own colleagues and outside competitors, the second one makes the players build a team to act together against outside competitors.

Game components are a map, player-tokens, outside competitor tokens and cards for the movement of the tokens. Players have to move their own and the competitor tokens in direction of the target field. If the value of outside competitor tokens exceeds the value of the players tokens on one field, the players tokens are send back to the starting field. In the first game a single player wins the game, in the second game all players lose or win, depending on the value of their tokens compared to the value of the outside competitor tokens.

—user summary

Name: ドゼクス (CODE6)
Description:
ãƒ‰ã‚¼ã‚¯ã‚¹ (CODE6) is a word deduction game from Japan for 3 players only (more can play if you provide extra chips).

Players are trying to deduce a word or expression from just a few letters laid out. The game has a deck of letter cards showing both the Roman letter and Japanese characters. But the deck represents the normal Hiragana sounds, so only 15 Roman letters are used including the vowel A. This enables players to construct Japanese words in steps that are more or less obvious.

Players declare a theme to their word and lay out cards in a crossword style, one by one. Players score points for correctly guessing words from limited steps.

The game was revised as Code 6+, with more components added, including hint cards. These allow the game to be more subtle and harder to crack. The guessing players can ask for hints, using six specific hint cards. These hints apply to parts of the secret word, or the whole meaning. The word deck was revised to remove dice symbols from the letter cards. Crib sheets of suitable words were included with the game to assist players.

The game relies upon a good knowledge of Hiragana words and would be difficult for non-speakers of Japanese.
user summary

Name: Ding Dong Donut
Description:
Oh no! The donuts lost their other half. Can you try and put them back together?

Each player flips a card when it is their turn. While this is going on, everybody simultaneously tries to find matching donut halves. Did you find any? Quick! Ring the bell. If you were correct, you may take the two matching cards and the game continues.

The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins. If you have a draw, the player with the most double donuts wins (sets of two cards, that complete not only one, but two full donuts).

Name: Catacombs Conquest: Event Horizon
Description:
The Event Horizon expansion provides a new way to play Catacombs Conquest. The Sword and Skull team card decks from the base game are replaced with the decks from this expansion. Each card has two shot sequences: a primary shot sequence that can be played immediately and a secondary shot sequence that must be activated by matching a "star sign" symbol. Each player has a set of five Leader cards that start the game face-up in front of them. Players then build their deck by choosing two sets of cards to play with from their team (fighters, spell casters, hunters, creatures, or explorers). Players must play a card from their hand (or flip over one of their Leader cards) to perform the card's primary sequence and may choose to play another card to activate the primary card's secondary shot sequence (a Leader card can also be used for this purpose). Anytime a player cannot draw a card, their discarded cards are reshuffled. The expansion adds the leech shot and new rules for the fireball, missile, and wave ranged shots. It also introduces the new "Dot" connector which enables *both* Character discs to perform a shot. The game features some new characters including the Dwarven Warrior, Siren, Oozing Maw, Stone Sentinel and Battle Robot.

-description from designer

Name: The Ur Variations
Description:
This hand-crafted artisanal gaming set combines four new games with four ancient games.  The new games include a devious abstract strategy game (Oasis), a crazy version of Senet in which you move both forward and backward on every turn, and can move not only the pawns but also the spaces on the board itself (Sand), an ultra fast and exciting push-your-luck game that plays in under 5 minutes (Caravan), and a 4-player multi-species strategy game (Ostriches and Alligators).  The ancient games include the Royal Game of Ur, the Advanced Game of Ur, Senet, and Aseb.

All games are played on a modular wooden gameboard into which different tiles are inserted in a different pattern for each game.  Some games make use of a modular "board extension" that consists of an extra two spaces for tiles.  Most of the games make use of throwing sticks as randomizers, though one game, Oasis, involves no luck at all.  Playing pieces include hand-painted wooden discs as well as pawns cast in resin from clay sculptures and then hand painted.

The Ur Variations is the third and final entry in game designer Zach Horton's "Ancient Games trilogy," following re-creations of Mehen and Men.

—description from the publisher

Name: My Singing Monsters: The Board Game
Description:
The Singing Monsters are the denizens of the Monster World – they live to sing and can be bred to create more Monsters.
